    "let @xmath0 be a smooth complex projective variety of dimension @xmath9 .",
    "let @xmath10 be an irreducible divisor with normal crossing singularities .",
    "one would like to relate the fundamental groups of @xmath0 and @xmath11 .",
    "there is a short exact sequence @xmath12 fix once and for all an element @xmath13 of @xmath6 going once around @xmath2 .",
    "the kernel @xmath14 is generated by the set @xmath15 the most definitive results on the fundamental group of @xmath16 are due to nori . if @xmath0 is a surface ( * ? ? ?",
    "3.27 ) implies that if @xmath17 ( where @xmath18 is number of nodes of @xmath2 ) then @xmath14 is a finitely generated abelian group , and its centralizer is a subgroup of finite index . in particular , his result implies zariski s conjecture : if @xmath19 , then @xmath20 is abelian ( since in this case @xmath17 is automatically satisfied ) .",
    "we will make the following assumption on the neron - severi group @xmath21 and the rank @xmath22 of the representations : @xmath23 the main result of this paper is that if @xmath4 has no irreducible @xmath5 representations , then @xmath6 has no irreducible @xmath7 representations .",
    "the motivation for this kind of result is the following .",
    "if @xmath24 is a representation such that @xmath25 is a multiple of the identity , then @xmath26 descends to give a representation @xmath27 .",
    "if @xmath28 is reducible , then also @xmath26 is reducible .",
    "of course this argument does nt work if @xmath25 is not a multiple of the identity , but using parabolic bundles ( and assuming ( 1 ) ) we show that this can not happen ( corollary [ corollary ] ) .",
    "we also give a similar result for @xmath8 representations ( theorem [ irred2 ] ) . here",
    "we have to assume that @xmath0 is a surface and @xmath2 is smooth , since the correspondence between representations and parabolic higgs bundles is only known under those conditions .",
    "let @xmath29 be a polarized smooth projective variety .",
    "all degrees and stability will be with respect to the polarization @xmath30 , unless otherwise stated .",
    "let @xmath10 be an irreducible divisor with normal crossing singularities .",
    "let @xmath31 be the composition of the normalization of @xmath2 with the inclusion in @xmath0 .",
    "let @xmath32 be a representation of the fundamental group of the complement .",
    "this gives a local system on @xmath16 .",
    "let @xmath33 be the deligne extension ( @xcite , @xcite ) , i.e. @xmath34 is a holomorphic vector bundle on @xmath0 ( with @xmath35 ) and @xmath36 is a holomorphic logarithmic connection .",
    "the restriction of the residue @xmath37 to a point in the normalization @xmath38 of @xmath2 is ( up to conjugation ) @xmath39 , where @xmath40 is the holonomy of @xmath26 on a small loop around @xmath2 , and the eigenvalues of @xmath39 satisfy @xmath41 .",
    "recall that a parabolic structure on a vector bundle @xmath34 or rank @xmath22 is a filtration of @xmath42 by holomorphic subbundles @xmath43 with weights @xmath44 where @xmath45 are the different eigenvalues ( without repetitions ) of @xmath39 .",
    "we say that the parabolic structure is trivial if @xmath46 ( i.e. all weights @xmath47 are equal ) .",
    "if @xmath34 is a torsion - free sheaf , then @xmath42 wo nt be locally free in general . in this case",
    "we only define the filtration in a zariski open subset of @xmath38 , in which @xmath42 is locally free",
    ". this will be sufficient for our purposes ( for a more general definition and for the notion of morphism between parabolic sheaves , see @xcite ) .",
    "the parabolic degree of @xmath34 is defined as @xmath48    we say that a parabolic bundle @xmath34 is parabolic stable ( resp .",
    "semistable ) if for any saturated torsion - free parabolic subsheaf @xmath49 or rank @xmath50 , @xmath51 and in general , all notions related to mumford stability ( slope , polystability , etc ... ) have a corresponding parabolic notion , changing the usual degree with the parabolic degree .",

    "then there is an associated polystable parabolic bundle @xmath34 of rank @xmath22 .",

    "let @xmath34 be a parabolic vector bundle with vanishing parabolic chern classes and rank @xmath22 .",
    "if @xmath34 is parabolic stable , then the parabolic structure is trivial ( all the weights are equal ) .",
    "assume that not all weights are equal .",
    "by lemma [ mumfordunstable ] , @xmath34 is mumford unstable",
    ". we will prove that @xmath34 is not parabolic stable by showing that at least one of the subsheaves of the harder - narasimhan filtration contradicts the parabolic stability of @xmath34 .",
    "since the parabolic degree of @xmath34 is zero , we have to prove that the parabolic degree of one of the subbundles is non - negative .",

    "the case when the parabolic structure is trivial is more subtle ( it is to cover this case that we need the assumption on the tangent bundle ) . since all the weights are equal , @xmath34 is mumford stable iff it is parabolic stable .",
    "but if @xmath34 is parabolic stable then there is a corresponding @xmath169 irreducible representation @xmath170 of @xmath6 , and since the weights are equal , @xmath171 is a multiple of the identity .",

    "this local construction defines a filtration on @xmath42 and hence a parabolic structure on @xmath34 .",
    "now we will prove that if the representation @xmath26 is irreducible , this parabolic structure is stable ( it will then follow that if @xmath26 is not irreducible , then the parabolic structure will still be polystable : decompose @xmath26 in irreducible representations , and then the parabolic bundle will be a direct sum of stable parabolic bundles , i.e. a polystable parabolic bundle ) .",
    "let @xmath49 be a saturated coherent torsion - free subsheaf of @xmath34 of rank @xmath50 .",
    "there is a naturally induced parabolic structure on @xmath49 whose weights are a subset of the weights of @xmath34 ( to check stability it is enough to look at parabolic subsheaves with this parabolic structure , since they have maximal parabolic degree ) .",
    "it is defined by considering the hermitian metric @xmath269 on @xmath49 obtained by restriction of the metric @xmath256 on @xmath34 .",
    "the metric @xmath269 is degenerate on the points where @xmath49 is not locally free or where @xmath270 is not an injection of vector bundles .",
    "let @xmath271 be the union of all such points .",
    "we define a parabolic structure as before , but only on @xmath272 ( i.e. the filtration of @xmath273 is only defined on @xmath274 .",
    "this is enough for our purpose : to calculate the parabolic degree ) .",

    "it is zero only if the second fundamental form @xmath297 is identically zero , but this would imply that there is a holomorphic splitting @xmath300 . the same argument in ( * ? ? ? * ( v.8.5 ) p. 183 ) shows that this extends to a holomorphic splitting on @xmath142 : since we have a splitting on @xmath301 , the holonomy group @xmath302 of @xmath303 on @xmath304 is in @xmath305 , and since @xmath271 is a closed subvariety ( of @xmath306 ) , the holonomy group on @xmath11 is contained in the closure of @xmath302 , and this is still in @xmath305 .",

    "* we would like to thank i. biswas for discussions .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a smooth complex projective variety with neron - severi group isomorphic to @xmath1 , and @xmath2 an irreducible divisor with normal crossing singularities . </S>",
    "<S> assume @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> we prove that if @xmath4 does nt have irreducible @xmath5 representations , then @xmath6 does nt have irreducible @xmath7 representations . </S>",
    "<S> the proof uses the non - existence of certain stable parabolic bundles . </S>",
    "<S> we also obtain a similar result for @xmath8 when @xmath2 is smooth and @xmath0 is a complex surface . </S>"
  ]
}
